venue.name: North Cemetery on North Main Street

item.description:
WEST HARTFORD HAUNTINGS RISES AGAIN; Noah Webster House Hosts Nighttime Cemetery Tours

This October, West Hartford Hauntings will return for its fourth year of frightful cemetery tours! The Noah Webster House & West Hartford Historical Society brings the residents of West Hartford’s North Cemetery back to life in this spooky theatrical show.



On Friday, Saturday, and Sunday nights, October 24-26, several of these past residents will rise to tell their stories. A milkman who froze to death tells his chilling tale, the first wife of a local minister shares her past, and a decapitated man speaks of being struck by a trolley. Not only do these and other ghosts tell their tales, specters, spooks, and phantoms also prowl the night.



Each evening, 12 tours will begin at the North Cemetery on North Main Street in West Hartford. There, tour goers will meet their guide- also a “past resident” of West Hartford. Tours depart every 15 minutes between 6 and 8:45 p.m.



Tickets are on sale now! Ticket prices are $9 for children 17 and under and $15 for adults. They are available through the museum by calling (860)521-5362 extension 21. For information on the availability of an American Sign Language interpreter, (available for certain tours) call ext 21 or email comments@noahwebsterhouse.org. West Hartford Hauntings is made possible by a grant from the Connecticut Humanities Council.

Call and Get Your tickets I will send my # to Yeses the Day Before. Maybe have Hot mulled cider up the hill if its available

group.name: The West Hartford Over 40 Fun Bunch!
